BootGrdWrn.label: Enable Boot Guard warning message at build time

PTTWrn.label: Enable Intel (R) Platform Trust Technology warning message at build time

OemBinary.label: OEM Section Binary
OemBinary.help_text: This loads the OEM Section binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel (R) FIT tool.

InputFile.label: GbE Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the Intel(R) Integrated LAN binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel (R) FIT tool.

Enabled.label: GbE Region Enable
Enabled.help_text: This option allows the user to enable or disable the Gigabit Ethernet Region.

InputFile.label: Intel(R) ME Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the Intel (R) ME binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

ChipsetInitBinary.label: Chipset Initialization Binary
ChipsetInitBinary.help_text: This loads the Chipset Initialization binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel (R) FIT tool. If specified, this will override the version contained in the Intel (R) ME binary.

IntelTrcHubBinary.label: Intel (R) Trace Hub Binary
IntelTrcHubBinary.help_text: This loads the Intel (R) Trace Hub binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

InputFile.label: PDR Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the Platform Data region binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel (R) FIT tool.

Enabled.label: PDR Region Enable
Enabled.help_text: This option allows the user to enable or disable the Platform Data Region.

InputFile.label: EC Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the Embedded Controller binary used for eSPI that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel (R) FIT tool.

Enabled.label: EC Region Enable
Enabled.help_text: This option allows the user to enable or disable the Embedded Controller Data Region.

EcRegionPointer.label: EC Region Pointer File
EcRegionPointer.help_text: This loads a binary containing the 16 byte value to be written in the Embedded Controller Pointer region.

InputFile.label: BIOS Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the BIOS binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel (R) FIT tool.

Enabled.label: BIOS Region Enable
Enabled.help_text: This option allows the user to enable or disable the Bios Region.

NumberOfSpiComponents.label: Number of Flash Components
NumberOfSpiComponents.help_text: This setting configures the total number of flash components for the platform. Note: Choosing a selection of '0' parts will cause the Intel (R) FIT tool to build an output image containing only the Intel (R) ME region.

FlashComponent1Size.label: Flash component 1 Size
FlashComponent1Size.help_text: This setting determines the size of Flash component 1 for the platform image.

FlashComponent2Size.label: Flash component 2 Size
FlashComponent2Size.help_text: This setting determines the size of Flash component 2 for the platform image. Note: This setting is only applicable when the Number of Flash Components option is set to '2'.

SpiVoltageSelect.label: SPI Voltage Select
SpiVoltageSelect.help_text: This strap sets the internal control signal on the pad for either 1.8 or 3.3 V operation. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details.

HostCpuWriteAccess.label: Host CPU / BIOS Write Access
HostCpuWriteAccess.help_text: This setting determines write access control for the BIOS region. For further details on Region Access Control see Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide.

HostCpuReadAccess.label: Host CPU / BIOS Read Access
HostCpuReadAccess.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the BIOS region. For further details on Region Access Control see Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide.

MeWriteAccess.label: Intel(R) ME Write Access
MeWriteAccess.help_text: This setting determines write access control for the ME region. For further details on Region Access Control see Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide.

MeReadAccess.label: Intel(R) ME Read Access
MeReadAccess.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the ME region. For further details on Region Access Control see Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide.

GbeWriteAccess.label: GbE Write Access
GbeWriteAccess.help_text: This setting determines write access control for the Gigabit Ethernet Region. For further details on Region Access Control see Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide.

GbeReadAccess.label: GbE Read Access
GbeReadAccess.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the Gigabit Ethernet Region. For further details on Region Access Control see Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide.

EcWriteAccess.label: Embedded Controller Write Access
EcWriteAccess.help_text: This setting determines write access control for the Embedded Controller region. For further details on Region Access Control see Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide.

EcReadAccess.label: Embedded Controller Read Access
EcReadAccess.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the Embedded Controller region. For further details on Region Access Control see Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide.

SpiDualIoReadEnable.label: Dual I/O Read Enabled
SpiDualIoReadEnable.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable support for Dual I/O Read capabilities for flash components. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details.

SpiDualOutReadEnable.label: Dual Output Read Enabled
SpiDualOutReadEnable.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable support for Dual Output Read capabilities for flash components. See the Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide.

FastReadClockFreq.label: Fast Read clock frequency
FastReadClockFreq.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure the flash component clock frequency setting for Fast Read. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details.

FastReadSupport.label: Fast Read supported
FastReadSupport.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable support for Fast Read capabilities for flash components. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details. Note: This setting needs to be enabled when using Dual / Quad enabled components.

InvalidInstruction0.label: Invalid Instruction 0
InvalidInstruction0.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are no Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction1.label: Invalid Instruction 1
InvalidInstruction1.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are no Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction2.label: Invalid Instruction 2
InvalidInstruction2.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are no Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction3.label: Invalid Instruction 3
InvalidInstruction3.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are no Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction4.label: Invalid Instruction 4
InvalidInstruction4.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are no Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction5.label: Invalid Instruction 5
InvalidInstruction5.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are no Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction6.label: Invalid Instruction 6
InvalidInstruction6.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are no Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction7.label: Invalid Instruction 7
InvalidInstruction7.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are no Invalid instructions.

QuadIoReadEnable.label: Quad I/O Read Enabled
QuadIoReadEnable.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable support for Quad I/O Read capabilities for flash components. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details.

QuadOutReadEnable.label: Quad Output Read Enabled
QuadOutReadEnable.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable support for Quad Output Read capabilities for flash components. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details.

ReadIdAndReadStatClkFreq.label: Read ID and Read Status clock frequency
ReadIdAndReadStatClkFreq.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure the flash component clock frequency setting for Read ID and Read Status. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details.

WriteEraseClockFreq.label: Write and Erase clock frequency
WriteEraseClockFreq.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure the flash component clock frequency setting for Write and Erase. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details.

VsccEntryName.label: Part Name
VsccEntryName.help_text: This setting allows the OEM input a name designation for each flash component being used. Note: This is a free form entry field it does not affect actual flash component operation.

VsccEntryVendorId.label: Vendor ID
VsccEntryVendorId.help_text: This configures the JEDEC vendor specific byte ID of the SPI flash Component. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details.

VsccEntryDeviceId0.label: Device ID 0
VsccEntryDeviceId0.help_text: This configures the JEDEC device specific byte ID 0 of the SPI flash Component. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details.

VsccEntryDeviceId1.label: Device ID 1
VsccEntryDeviceId1.help_text: This configures the JEDEC device specific byte ID 1 of the SPI flash Component. See Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details.

TopSwapOverride.label: Top Swap Block Size
TopSwapOverride.help_text: This configures the Top Swap Block size for the platform. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

ProcEmulation.value_list: No Emulation,,EMULATE Intel (R) vPro (TM) capable Processor,,EMULATE Intel (R) Core (TM) branded Processor,,EMULATE Intel (R) Celeron (R) branded Processor,,EMULATE Intel (R) Pentium (R) branded Processor,,EMULATE Intel (R) Xeon (R) branded Processor,,EMULATE Intel (R) Xeon (R) Manageability capable Processor
ProcEmulation.label: Processor Emulation
ProcEmulation.help_text: This setting determines processor type to be emulated on pre-production silicon.

FwUpdateOemId.label: Firmware Update OEM ID
FwUpdateOemId.help_text: This setting allows configuration of an OEM unique ID to ensure that customers can only update their platform with images from the OEM of the platform.

HideMEBxFwUpdCtrl.label: Hide MEBx Firmware Update Control
HideMEBxFwUpdCtrl.help_text: This setting allows customers to hide the Firmware Update option in the MEBx interface.

HmrfpoEnable.label: Intel(R) ME Region Flash Protection Override
HmrfpoEnable.help_text: This setting enables descriptor unlock of the ME Region when the HMRFPO message is sent to firmware prior to BIOS End of POST.

OdmIDIntelServices.label: ODM ID used by Intel(R) Services
OdmIDIntelServices.help_text: This setting is for entering the ODM ID for Intel(R) Services to identify the ODM Board builder. Note: This ID is either generated by or registered with Intel(R) Services Web servers.

SysIntIdIntelServices.label: System Integrator ID used by Intel(R) Services
SysIntIdIntelServices.help_text: This setting is for entering the System Integrator ID for Intel(R) Services to identify the System Integrator. Note: This ID is either generated by or registered with Intel(R) Services Web servers.

ReservedIdIntelServices.label: Reserved ID used by Intel(R) Services
ReservedIdIntelServices.help_text: This setting is for entering the Reserved ID for Intel(R) Services currently not used.

OemTag.label: OEM Tag
OemTag.help_text: This is a free form 32bit field that allows the OEM to configure their own unique identifier in the firmware image.

MctpStackConfig.label: MCTP Stack Configuration
MctpStackConfig.help_text: Defines the ME's 8-bits MCTP Endpoint IDs for each SMBus physical interface (SMBus, SMLink0 and SMLink1). These values are needed for FW to communicate with MCTP end points. For each of these 3 bytes, a value of 0x00 means not used, and values 0xFF or 0x01 - 0x07 or 0x20 - 0x2F are not allowed.

FwAutoBist.label: Automatic Built in Self Test
FwAutoBist.help_text: This setting enables the firmware Automatic Built in Self Test which is executed during first platform boot after initial image flashing.

NvarPostManLck.label: Post Manufacturing NVAR Configuration Enabled
NvarPostManLck.help_text: This setting determines if modifications to Customer configuable NVARs is to be allowed after close of manufacturing.

AmtSupported.label: Intel(R) AMT Supported
AmtSupported.help_text: This setting allows customers to disable Intel(R) AMT on the platform and force the platform into Standard Manageability mode. Note: This setting is only applies to Desktop and Workstation platforms.

NetServicesSupported.label: Intel(R) ME Network Services Supported
NetServicesSupported.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable / disable Intel(R) ME Network Services on the platform. Note: If this setting is disabled Intel(R) AMT will also be disabled.

MngAppSupported.label: Manageability Application Supported
MngAppSupported.help_text: This setting allows customers to permenantly disable Intel(R) AMT and Standard Manageability mode on the platform.

MngAppPowerUpState.label: Manageability Application initial power-up state
MngAppPowerUpState.help_text: This setting allows customers to determine the power up state for Intel(R) AMT or Standard Manageability. Note: If this setting is disabled Intel(R) AMT or Standard Manageability can still be re-enabled through the MEBx interface.

AmtIdleTimeout.label: Intel(R) AMT Idle Timeout
AmtIdleTimeout.help_text: This setting configures the idle timeout value before Intel(R) AMT enters into an off state.

AmtWdAutoReset.label: Intel(R) AMT Watchdog Automatic Reset Enabled
AmtWdAutoReset.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable the Intel (R) ME firmware to trigger an automatic platform reset if either the MEI or Agent Presence are in a hung state. Note: This feature only allows one reset at a time when the watchdog expires. After this feature has triggered a reset it must be re-armed for re-use via management console.

KvmScreenBlnkEnable.label: Firmware KVM Screen Blanking
KvmScreenBlnkEnable.help_text: This setting enables KVM Screen blanking capabilities in the firmware image. Note: This feature is dependent on processor level support.

KvmSupported.label: KVM Redirection Supported
KvmSupported.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable / disable the KVM Redirection capabilities of the firmware. Note: If this setting have been set to disabled it cannot be re-enabled once the descriptor has been locked.

EhbcEnable.label: Embedded Host Based Configuration Enabled
EhbcEnable.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable / disable Embedded Host Based Configuration. Important: EHBC is primarily intended for use in embedded systems as it offers less user privacy/security protection than may be appropriate for business client systems.

PkiDomainSuffix.label: PKI Domain Name Suffix
PkiDomainSuffix.help_text: This setting allows OEMs to pre-configure the Domain Name Suffix used for PKI provisioning in their firmware image. Note: For normal out-of- box provisioning functionality this setting should be left empty.

CertActive.label: Certificate Enabled
CertActive.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable PKI provisioning Custom Certificate 1.

CertFriendly.label: Certificate Friendly Name
CertFriendly.help_text: This setting allows customers to assign a user friendly name for PKI provisioning Custom Certificate 1. Maximum of 32 characters.

CertStream.label: Certificate Stream
CertStream.help_text: This setting allows customers to input hash stream for PKI provisioning Custom Certificate 1. If enabled the certificate will be used in addition those already preloaded in base firmware during provisioning. Note: If the platform is un-configured the Custom Certificate Hash will be deleted.

CertActive.label: Certificate Enabled
CertActive.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable PKI provisioning Custom Certificate 2.

CertFriendly.label: Certificate Friendly Name
CertFriendly.help_text: This setting allows customers to assign a user friendly name for PKI provisioning Custom Certificate 2. Maximum of 32 characters.

CertStream.label: Certificate Stream
CertStream.help_text: This setting allows customers to input hash stream for PKI provisioning custom certificate 2. If enabled the certificate will be used in addition those already preloaded in base firmware during provisioning. Note: If the platform is un-configured the Custom Certificate Hash will be deleted.

CertActive.label: Certificate Enabled
CertActive.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable PKI provisioning Custom Certificate 3.

CertFriendly.label: Certificate Friendly Name
CertFriendly.help_text: This setting allows customers to assign a user friendly name for PKI provisioning Custom Certificate 3. Maximum of 32 characters.

CertStream.label: Certificate Stream
CertStream.help_text: This setting allows customers to input hash stream for PKI provisioning Custom Certificate 3. If enabled the certificate will be used in addition those already preloaded in base firmware during provisioning. Note: If the platform is un-configured the Custom Certificate Hash will be deleted.

CertActive.label: Certificate Enabled
CertActive.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable PKI provisioning Default certificate 1.

CertFriendly.label: Certificate Friendly Name
CertFriendly.help_text: This setting allows customers to assign a user friendly name for PKI provisioning Default Certificate 1. Maximum of 32 characters.

CertStream.label: Certificate Stream
CertStream.help_text: This setting allows customers to input hash stream for PKI provisioning custom certificate 1. Note: Default Certificates if enabled will be used in addition those already preloaded in firmware during provisioning. Unlike Customizable Certificates the Default Certificates are not deleted when the platform is un-provisioned.

CertActive.label: Certificate Enabled
CertActive.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable PKI provisioning Default certificate 2.

CertFriendly.label: Certificate Friendly Name
CertFriendly.help_text: This setting allows customers to assign a user friendly name for PKI provisioning Default Certificate 2. Maximum of 32 characters.

CertStream.label: Certificate Stream
CertStream.help_text: This setting allows customers to input hash stream for PKI provisioning custom certificate 2. Note: Default Certificates if enabled will be used in addition those already preloaded in firmware during provisioning. Unlike Customizable Certificates the Default Certificates are not deleted when the platform is un-provisioned.

CertActive.label: Certificate Enabled
CertActive.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable PKI provisioning Default certificate 3.

CertFriendly.label: Certificate Friendly Name
CertFriendly.help_text: This setting allows customers to assign a user friendly name for PKI provisioning Default Certificate 3. Maximum of 32 characters.

CertStream.label: Certificate Stream
CertStream.help_text: This setting allows customers to input hash stream for PKI provisioning custom certificate 3. Note: Default Certificates if enabled will be used in addition those already preloaded in firmware during provisioning. Unlike Customizable Certificates the Default Certificates are not deleted when the platform is un-provisioned.

CertActive.label: Certificate Enabled
CertActive.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable PKI provisioning Default certificate 4.

CertFriendly.label: Certificate Friendly Name
CertFriendly.help_text: This setting allows customers to assign a user friendly name for PKI provisioning Default Certificate 4. Maximum of 32 characters.

CertStream.label: Certificate Stream
CertStream.help_text: This setting allows customers to input hash stream for PKI provisioning custom certificate 4. Note: Default Certificates if enabled will be used in addition those already preloaded in firmware during provisioning. Unlike Customizable Certificates the Default Certificates are not deleted when the platform is un-provisioned.

CertActive.label: Certificate Enabled
CertActive.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable PKI provisioning Default certificate 5.

CertFriendly.label: Certificate Friendly Name
CertFriendly.help_text: This setting allows customers to assign a user friendly name for PKI provisioning Default Certificate 5. Maximum of 32 characters.

CertStream.label: Certificate Stream
CertStream.help_text: This setting allows customers to input hash stream for PKI provisioning custom certificate 5. Note: Default Certificates if enabled will be used in addition those already preloaded in firmware during provisioning. Unlike Customizable Certificates the Default Certificates are not deleted when the platform is un-provisioned.

RedirectionLanguage.label: Redirection Localized Language
RedirectionLanguage.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure which localized language will be used initially by firmware for user consent output information (Examples: may be displayed before SOL / KVM session starts).

RedirectionPrivSecLevel.label: Redirection Privacy / Security Level
RedirectionPrivSecLevel.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure the Privacy and Security level for redirection operations. Default enables all redirection ports (User consent is configurable). Enhanced enables all redirection ports (User consent is required and cannot be disabled). Extreme disables all redirection capabilities.

TlsSupported.label: Transport Layer Security Supported
TlsSupported.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable / disable firmware Transport Layer Security support. Note: If this is disabled TLS will be permanently disabled in the firmware image.

PavpSupported.label: PAVP Supported
PavpSupported.help_text: This setting determines if the Protected Audio Video Path (PAVP) feature will be permanently disabled in the firmware image.

Lspcon4kdisp.label: LSPCON Internal Display Port 1 - LSPCON / 4K
Lspcon4kdisp.help_text: This setting determines which port for LSPCON will be connected to the HDCP 2.2 bridge adapter Display 1.

Hdcp5kedisp1.label: HDCP Internal Display Port 1 - 5K
Hdcp5kedisp1.help_text: This setting determines which port is connected for 5K output on Internal Display 1. Note: Both Display 1 & 2 need to be configured for proper operation.

Hdcp5kedisp2.label: HDCP Internal Display Port 2 - 5K
Hdcp5kedisp2.help_text: This setting determines which port is connected for 5K output on Internal Display 2. Note: Both Display 1 & 2 need to be configured for proper operation.

GucHash.label: GuC Encryption Key
GucHash.help_text: This option is for entering the raw hash 256 bit string for the Graphics uController.

KeyConfiguration.label: Hash Key Configuration for Bootguard / ISH

OemPublicKeyHash.label: OEM Public Key Hash
OemPublicKeyHash.help_text: This option is for entering the raw hash string for Boot Guard or ISH. This 256-bit field represents the SHA-256 hash of the OEM public key corresponding to the private key used to sign the BIOS-SM for Bootguard or ISH firmware.

BtGuardKeyManifestId.label: Key Manifest ID
BtGuardKeyManifestId.help_text: This option is for entering the hash of another public key, used by the ACM to verify the Boot Policy Manifest.

BtGuardProfileConfig.value_list: Boot Guard Profile 0 - No_FVME,,Boot Guard Profile 1 - VE,,Boot Guard Profile 2 - VME,,Boot Guard Profile 3 - VM,,Boot Guard Profile 4 - FVE,,Boot Guard Profile 5 - FVME
BtGuardProfileConfig.label: Boot Guard Profile Configuration
BtGuardProfileConfig.help_text: This option configures the which Boot Guard Policy Profile will be used.

BtGuardCpuDebugEnable.label: CPU Debugging
BtGuardCpuDebugEnable.help_text: When set to Enabled the CPU debugging capability probe mode is enabled. When this field is set to Disabled it indicates CPU debugging capability probe mode is disabled and locked.

BtGuardBspInitEnable.label: BSP Initialization
BtGuardBspInitEnable.help_text: This setting determines BSP behavior when it receives an INIT signal. When set to 'Enabled', when BSP receives an INIT, BSP will signal an error to the BSS register and enter unrecoverable shutdown.

PttPwrUpState.label: Intel(R) PTT initial power-up state
PttPwrUpState.help_text: This setting determines if Intel(R) PTT is enabled on platform power-up.

PttSupported.label: Intel(R) PTT Supported
PttSupported.help_text: This setting permanently disables Intel(R) PTT in the firmware image.

PttSupportedHw.label: Intel(R) PTT Supported [FPF]
PttSupportedHw.help_text: This setting will permanently disable Intel(R) PTT through platform FPFs. Caution: Using this option will permanently disable Intel(R) PTT on the platform hardware.

PttRtcClearDetect.label: Intel(R) PTT RTC Clear Detection
PttRtcClearDetect.help_text: This setting determines how the Intel(R) PTT will behave when RTC (CMOS) clear is triggered on the platform. When Disabled Intel(R) PTT will bypass normal RTC clear behavior. Note: For designs where there is no Physical Coin Cell Battery, for backing up data stored in the RTC well, this setting should be set to 'Disabled'.

SpiOverTpmClkFreq.label: TPM Clock Frequency
SpiOverTpmClkFreq.help_text: This setting determines the clock frequency setting to be used for the TPM over SPI bus.

SpiOverTpmBusEnable.label: TPM Over SPI Bus Enabled
SpiOverTpmBusEnable.help_text: This setting determines if TPM over SPI bus is enabled on the platform.

BiosGrdProtOvrdEn.label: BIOS Guard Protection Override Enabled
BiosGrdProtOvrdEn.help_text: This setting allows BIOS Guard to bypass SPI flash controller protections (i.e. Protected Range Registers and Top Swap).

RegisterLockPolicy.label: Register Lock Policy
RegisterLockPolicy.help_text: Policy applied to ICC Registers at EOP.

FailsafeBootProfile.label: Failsafe Boot Profile
FailsafeBootProfile.help_text: Boot profile used when system instability is detected.

ProfileChangeable.label: Profile Changeable
ProfileChangeable.help_text: True = Allows user to change boot profile via BIOS menu or 3rd party application False = Prevents user from changing boot profile via BIOS or 3rd party application. Note: When false, Failsafe Boot Profile must be the same as Boot Profile.

ProfileName.label: Profile Name
ProfileName.help_text: Editable text string stored with the profile for easy identification.

ProfileType.label: Profile Type
ProfileType.help_text: Specifies the profile template used when creating the profile. Intel (R) ME image has to be loaded to enable other ICC profile settings.

GbeMacSmbAddrs.label: GbE MAC SMBus Address
GbeMacSmbAddrs.help_text: This setting configures Intel(R) Integrated Wired LAN MAC SMBus address to accept SMBus cycles from the PHY. Note: Recommended setting is 70h.

GbeMacSmbAddrsEn.label: GbE MAC SMBus Address Enabled
GbeMacSmbAddrsEn.help_text: This enables the Intel(R) Integrated Wired LAN MAC SMBus address. Note: This setting must be enabled if using Intel(R) Integrated LAN.

GbePhyPcieEnable.label: Intel(R) PHY over PCIe Enabled
GbePhyPcieEnable.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable / disable Intel(R) Integrated LAN operation over the PCIe Port selected by the GbE PCIe Port Select option.

GbePCIePortSelect.label: GbE PCIe Port Select
GbePCIePortSelect.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure the PCIe Port that will Intel(R) Integrated LAN will operate on.

GbePHYSmbAddrs.label: GbE PHY SMBus Address
GbePHYSmbAddrs.help_text: This setting configures Intel(R) Integrated Wired LAN SMBus address to accept SMBus cycles from the MAC. Note: Recommended setting is 64h.

MELanPowerWell.label: LAN Power Well
MELanPowerWell.help_text: This setting allows the customer to configure the powerwell that will be used by Intel(R) Integrated LAN. Note: Recommended setting is SLP_LAN#.

LanPhyPwrCtrlGpd11Config.label: LAN PHY Power Control GPD11 Signal Configuration
LanPhyPwrCtrlGpd11Config.help_text: This setting allows the user to assign the LAN PHY Power Control signal to GbE or as GPD11. Note: If using Intel(R) Integrated LAN this setting should be set to 'LANPHYPC'.

LanPhyPwrUpTime.label: LAN PHY Power Up Time
LanPhyPwrUpTime.help_text: This bit determines how long the delay for LAN PHY to power up after de-assertion of SLP_LAN#.

LanEnable.label: Intel(R) Integrated Wired LAN Enable
LanEnable.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable / disable Intel(R) Integrated LAN operation over the PCIe Port selected by the GbE PCIe Port Select option.

PhyConnected.value_list: No PHY Connected,,PHY on SMBus,,PHY on SMLink0,,PHY on SMLink1
PhyConnected.label: PHY Connection
PhyConnected.help_text: This selects which SMBus network is used to connect GbE Legacy PHY to MAC/PCH.

MeClinkEnable.label: Intel (R) ME CLINK Signal Enabled
MeClinkEnable.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable / disable the Wireless LAN CLINK signal through Intel (R) ME firmware. Note: For using Intel(R) vPro Wireless solutions this should be set to 'Yes'.

WlanUcode.label: WLAN Microcode
WlanUcode.help_text: This setting allows OEMs to configure which Intel(R) Wireless LAN card microcode to load into the firmware image.

MEWlanPowerWell.value_list: Disabled,,Core Well || SLP_S3#,,Primary Well || SLP_SUS#,,ME Well || SLP_A#,,SLP_WLAN#
MEWlanPowerWell.label: WLAN Power Well
MEWlanPowerWell.help_text: This setting allows the customer to configure the powerwell that will be used by Intel(R) Wireless LAN. Note: Recommended setting is SLP_WLAN#.

SlpWlanGpd9Config.label: SLP_WLAN# / GPD9 Signal Configuration
SlpWlanGpd9Config.help_text: This setting allows the user to assign the WLAN Power Control signal to WLAN or as GPD9. Note: If using Intel(R) Wireless LAN this setting should be set to 'SLP_WLAN#'.

RstPCIe1C2Select.label: Intel(R) RST for PCIe-C2 Select x2 or x4
RstPCIe1C2Select.help_text: This is used to configure NAND Cycle routers for the Intel(R) RST for PCIe interface as either x2 or x4 lane operation on PCIe Controller 2 [LP] or PCIe Controller 6 [S / H]. Note: This setting must match port configuration settings of Intel (R) RST for PCIe Controller 2 and PCIe Controller 2 [LP] or PCIe Controller 6 [S / H].

RstPCIe1C3Select.label: Intel(R) RST for PCIe-C3 Select x2 or x4
RstPCIe1C3Select.help_text: This is used to configure NAND Cycle routers for the Intel(R) RST for PCIe interface as either x2 or x4 lane operation on PCIe Controller 3 [LP] or PCIe Controller 5 [S / H]. Note: This setting must match port configuration settings of Intel (R) RST for PCIe Controller 3 and PCIe Controller 3 [LP] or PCIe Controller 5 [S / H].

RstPCIeController2.label: Intel(R) RST for PCIe Controller 2
RstPCIeController2.help_text: This is used to configure PCIe Controller 2 for Intel(R) RST for PCIe interface as either x2 or x4 lane operation on PCIe Controller 2 [LP] or PCIe Controller 6 [S / H]. Note: This setting must match port configuration settings of Intel(R) RST for PCIe-C2 Select x2 or x4 and PCIe Controller 2 [LP] or PCIe Controller 6 [S / H].

RstPCIeController3.label: Intel(R) RST for PCIe Controller 3
RstPCIeController3.help_text: This is used to configure PCIe Controller 3 for Intel(R) RST for PCIe interface as either x2 or x4 lane operation on PCIe Controller 3 [LP] or PCIe Controller 5 [S / H]. Note: This setting must match port configuration settings of Intel(R) RST for PCIe-C3 Select x2 or x4 and PCIe Controller 3 [LP] or PCIe Controller 5 [S / H].

PCIeCtrl2Port1SrisEnable.label: PCIe Controller 2 Port 1 SRIS Enabled
PCIeCtrl2Port1SrisEnable.help_text: This is used to configure SRIS Port 1 for Intel(R) RST for PCIe on PCIe Controller 2. Note: Configuration of this setting is only required if the NVM device will be connected external SATA Express cable.

PCIeCtrl2Port2SrisEnable.label: PCIe Controller 2 Port 2 SRIS Enabled
PCIeCtrl2Port2SrisEnable.help_text: This is used to configure SRIS Port 2 for Intel(R) RST for PCIe on PCIe Controller 2. Note: Configuration of this setting is only required if the NVM device will be connected external SATA Express cable.

PCIeCtrl2Port3SrisEnable.label: PCIe Controller 2 Port 3 SRIS Enabled
PCIeCtrl2Port3SrisEnable.help_text: This is used to configure SRIS Port 3 for Intel(R) RST for PCIe on PCIe Controller 2. Note: Configuration of this setting is only required if the NVM device will be connected external SATA Express cable.

PCIeCtrl2Port4SrisEnable.label: PCIe Controller 2 Port 4 SRIS Enabled
PCIeCtrl2Port4SrisEnable.help_text: This is used to configure SRIS Port 4 for Intel(R) RST for PCIe on PCIe Controller 2. Note: Configuration of this setting is only required if the NVM device will be connected external SATA Express cable.

PCIeCtrl3Port1SrisEnable.label: PCIe Controller 3 Port 1 SRIS Enabled
PCIeCtrl3Port1SrisEnable.help_text: This is used to configure SRIS Port 1 for Intel(R) RST for PCIe on PCIe Controller 3. Note: Configuration of this setting is only required if the NVM device will be connected external SATA Express cable.

PCIeCtrl3Port2SrisEnable.label: PCIe Controller 3 Port 2 SRIS Enabled
PCIeCtrl3Port2SrisEnable.help_text: This is used to configure SRIS Port 2 for Intel(R) RST for PCIe on PCIe Controller 3. Note: Configuration of this setting is only required if the NVM device will be connected external SATA Express cable.

PCIeCtrl3Port3SrisEnable.label: PCIe Controller 3 Port 3 SRIS Enabled
PCIeCtrl3Port3SrisEnable.help_text: This is used to configure SRIS Port 3 for Intel(R) RST for PCIe on PCIe Controller 3. Note: Configuration of this setting is only required if the NVM device will be connected external SATA Express cable.

PCIeCtrl3Port4SrisEnable.label: PCIe Controller 3 Port 4 SRIS Enabled
PCIeCtrl3Port4SrisEnable.help_text: This is used to configure SRIS Port 4 for Intel(R) RST for PCIe on PCIe Controller 3. Note: Configuration of this setting is only required if the NVM device will be connected external SATA Express cable.

PCIeCtrl1LnReversal.label: PCIe Controller 1 Lane Reversal Enabled
PCIeCtrl1LnReversal.help_text: This setting allows the PCIe lanes on Controller 1 to be reversed. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

PCIeCtrl2LnReversal.label: PCIe Controller 2 Lane Reversal Enabled
PCIeCtrl2LnReversal.help_text: This setting allows the PCIe lanes on Controller 2 to be reversed. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

PCIeCtrl3LnReversal.label: PCIe Controller 3 Lane Reversal Enabled
PCIeCtrl3LnReversal.help_text: This setting allows the PCIe lanes on Controller 3 to be reversed. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

PCIeController1Config.label: PCIe Controller 1 (Port 1-4)
PCIeController1Config.help_text: This setting controls PCIe Port configurations for PCIe Controller 1. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

PCIeController2Config.label: PCIe Controller 2 (Port 5-8)
PCIeController2Config.help_text: This setting controls PCIe Port configurations for PCIe Controller 2. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

PCIeController3Config.label: PCIe Controller 3 (Port 9-12)
PCIeController3Config.help_text: This setting controls PCIe Port configurations for PCIe Controller 3. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS. Note: For Skylake-LP Base U and Premium Y PCIe Controller 3 has only Port 9-10 and is limited to 1x2, 2x1 port configuration only. For these platforms use only the 1x2, 2x1 and 2x2 settings for port configurations.

SataPCIeComboPort0.label: SATA / PCIe Combo Port 0
SataPCIeComboPort0.help_text: This setting configures the PCIe port to operate as either PCIe Port 7 or SATA Port 0. For further details on Flex I/O see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SataPCIeComboPort1.label: SATA / PCIe Combo Port 1
SataPCIeComboPort1.help_text: This setting configures the PCIe port to operate as either PCIe Port 8 or SATA Port 1. For further details on Flex I/O see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SataPCIeComboPort2.label: SATA / PCIe Combo Port 2
SataPCIeComboPort2.help_text: This setting configures the PCIe port to operate as either PCIe Port 11 or SATA Port 1. For further details on Flex I/O see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS. Note: This setting is only valid for For Skylake Premium U.

SataPCIeComboPort3.label: SATA / PCIe Combo Port 3
SataPCIeComboPort3.help_text: This setting configures the PCIe port to operate as either PCIe Port 12 or SATA Port 2. For further details on Flex I/O see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS. Note: This Combo Port only applies to ULT based MCPs. Note: This setting is only valid for For Skylake Premium U.

SataPcieComboPortSelectPolarity.label: SATA / PCIe Combo Port Select Polarity

SataPCIePolSelComboPort0.label: Polarity Select SATA / PCIe Combo Port 0
SataPCIePolSelComboPort0.help_text: This setting is used to determine the native mode configuration for SATA / PCIe Combo Port 0. For further details on Flex I/O see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SataPCIePolSelComboPort1.label: Polarity Select SATA / PCIe Combo Port 1
SataPCIePolSelComboPort1.help_text: This setting is used to determine the native mode configuration for SATA / PCIe Combo Port 1. For further details on Flex I/O see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SataPCIePolSelComboPort2.label: Polarity Select SATA / PCIe Combo Port 2
SataPCIePolSelComboPort2.help_text: This setting is used to determine the native mode configuration for SATA / PCIe Combo Port 2. For further details on Flex I/O see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SataPCIePolSelComboPort3.label: Polarity Select SATA / PCIe Combo Port 3
SataPCIePolSelComboPort3.help_text: This setting is used to determine the native mode configuration for SATA / PCIe Combo Port 3. For further details on Flex I/O see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

USB3PCIeComboPort0.label: USB3 / PCIe Combo Port 0
USB3PCIeComboPort0.help_text: This setting configures the PCIe port to operate as either PCIe Port 1 or USB3 Port 5. For further details on Flex I/O see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

USB3PCIeComboPort1.label: USB3 / PCIe Combo Port 1
USB3PCIeComboPort1.help_text: This setting configures the PCIe port to operate as either PCIe Port 2 or USB3 Port 6. For further details on Flex I/O see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

USB3SSICComboPort1.label: USB3 / SSIC Combo Port 1
USB3SSICComboPort1.help_text: This setting configures USB3 Port 2 to operate as either USB3 or SSIC. For further details on Flex I/O see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

XHCIPort1Ownership.label: XHCI Port 1 Ownership
XHCIPort1Ownership.help_text: This setting configures USB3 Port 1 to operate as either XHCI or Non-XHCI. For further details on Flex I/O see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

XHCIPort2Ownership.label: XHCI Port 2 Ownership
XHCIPort2Ownership.help_text: This setting configures USB3 Port 2 to operate as either XHCI or Non-XHCI. For further details on Flex I/O see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

XHCIPort3Ownership.label: XHCI Port 3 Ownership
XHCIPort3Ownership.help_text: This setting configures USB3 Port 3 to operate as either XHCI or Non-XHCI. For further details on Flex I/O see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

XHCIPort4Ownership.label: XHCI Port 4 Ownership
XHCIPort4Ownership.help_text: This setting configures USB3 Port 4 to operate as either XHCI or Non-XHCI. For further details on Flex I/O see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

XHCIPort5Ownership.label: XHCI Port 5 Ownership
XHCIPort5Ownership.help_text: This setting configures USB3 Port 5 to operate as either XHCI or Non-XHCI. For further details on Flex I/O see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

XHCIPort6Ownership.label: XHCI Port 6 Ownership
XHCIPort6Ownership.help_text: This setting configures USB3 Port 6 to operate as either XHCI or Non-XHCI. For further details on Flex I/O see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

OpiLinkSpeed.label: OPI Link Speed
OpiLinkSpeed.help_text: This setting configures the OPI Link Speed. For further details see Skylake PCH EDS.

OpiLinkWidth.label: OPI Link Width
OpiLinkWidth.help_text: This setting configures the OPI Link Width. For further details see Skylake PCH EDS.

OpiLinkVoltage.label: OPI Link Voltage
OpiLinkVoltage.help_text: This setting configures the OPI Link Voltage. For further details see Skylake PCH EDS.

DmiLaneReversal.label: DMI Lane Reversal
DmiLaneReversal.help_text: This setting allows the DMI Lane signals to be reversed. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

DmiPciPortStagger.label: DMI Port Staggering
DmiPciPortStagger.help_text: This setting configures DMI for Port Staggering. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

EspiEcMaxOutReqMstrFlCh.label: eSPI / EC Max Outstanding Requests for Master Attached Flash Channel

EspiEcMaxPldSizeOOBCh.value_list: 64 bytes,,128 bytes,,256 bytes,,512 bytes,,1024 bytes,,2048 bytes,,4096 bytes
EspiEcMaxPldSizeOOBCh.label: eSPI / EC Max Read Request Payload size for OOB Channel

EspiEcMaxPldSizePeriphCh.value_list: 64 bytes,,128 bytes,,256 bytes,,512 bytes,,1024 bytes,,2048 bytes,,4096 bytes
EspiEcMaxPldSizePeriphCh.label: eSPI / EC Max Read Request Payload size for Peripheral Channel

EspiEcMaxVirtualWireCh.label: eSPI / EC Max Virtual Wire Channels

EspiEcMaxIoMode.value_list: Single,,Single and Dual,,Single and Quad,,Single, Dual and Quad
EspiEcMaxIoMode.label: eSPI / EC Maximum I/O Mode

EspiEcSlvDevBusfreq.label: eSPI / EC Slave Device Bus Frequency

EspiEcSlvDevCrcChkEn.label: eSPI / EC Slave Device CRC Check Enabled

EspiEcSlvDevMpsOOBCh.value_list: 64 bytes,,128 bytes,,256 bytes,,512 bytes,,1024 bytes,,2048 bytes,,4096 bytes
EspiEcSlvDevMpsOOBCh.label: eSPI / EC Slave Device Max Read Request Payload size for OOB Channel

EspiEcSlvDevMpsPeriphCh.value_list: 64 bytes,,128 bytes,,256 bytes,,512 bytes,,1024 bytes,,2048 bytes,,4096 bytes
EspiEcSlvDevMpsPeriphCh.label: eSPI / EC Slave Device Max Read Request Payload size for Peripheral Channel

EspiEcSlvDevVwireCh.label: eSPI / EC Slave Device Max Virtual Wire Channels

EspiEcSlvDevMaxIoMode.value_list: Single,,Single and Dual,,Single and Quad,,Single, Dual and Quad
EspiEcSlvDevMaxIoMode.label: eSPI / EC Slave Device Maximum I/O Mode

EspiEcSlvDevOOBChEn.label: eSPI / EC Slave Device OOB Channel Enabled

EspiEcSlvDevPeriphChEn.label: eSPI / EC Slave Device Peripheral Channel Enabled

EspiEcSlvDevVWEn.label: eSPI / EC Slave Device Virtual Wire Channel Enabled

EspiLwFreqDbgOvr.label: eSPI Low Frequency Debug Override
EspiLwFreqDbgOvr.help_text: When enabled this setting will divide eSPI clock frequency by 8. Note: This setting should only be used for debugging purposes. Leaving this setting enable will impact eSPI performance.

ApwrokTiming.label: APWROK Timing
ApwrokTiming.help_text: This soft strap determines the time between the SLP_A# pin de-asserting and the APWROK timer expiration. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

t573TimingConfig.label: PCH clock output stable to PROCPWRGD high (tPCH45)
t573TimingConfig.help_text: This setting configures the minimum timing from XCK_PLL locked to CPUPWRGD high. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

t36TimerEnable.label: PCIe Power Stable Timer (tPCH33)
t36TimerEnable.help_text: This setting configures the enables / disables the tPCH33 timer. When enabled PCH will count 99ms from PWROK assertion before PLTRST# is de-asserted. Note: The recommended setting is 'Disabled'.

t1001TimingConfig.label: PROCPWRGD and SYS_PWROK high to SUS_STAT# de-assertion (tPCH46)
t1001TimingConfig.help_text: This setting configures the minimum timing from CPUPWRGD assertion to SUS_STAT#. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SMBusAsdEnable.label: Intel(R) SMBus ASD Address Enabled
SMBusAsdEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables the Intel(R) SMBus Alert Sending Device. For details see Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide.

SMBusAsdAddress.label: Intel(R) SMBus ASD Address
SMBusAsdAddress.help_text: This setting configures the Intel(R) SMBus Alert Sending Device Address. For details see Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide.

SMBusI2cEnable.label: Intel(R) SMBus I2C Address Enabled
SMBusI2cEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables the Intel(R) SMBus I2C Address. Note: This setting is only used for testing purposes. The recommended setting is 'No'.

SMBusI2cAddress.label: Intel(R) SMBus I2C Address
SMBusI2cAddress.help_text: This setting configures the Intel(R) SMBus I2C Address. Note: This setting is only used for testing purposes. The recommended setting is '0x00'.

SMBusMctpEnable.label: Intel(R) SMBus MCTP Address Enabled
SMBusMctpEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables the Intel(R) SMBus MCTP Address. Note: This setting is only used for testing purposes. The recommended setting is 'No'.

SMBusMctpAddress.label: Intel(R) SMBus MCTP Address
SMBusMctpAddress.help_text: This setting configures the Intel(R) SMBus MCTP Address. Note: This setting is only used for testing purposes. The default setting is '0x00'.

SMBusAsfId.label: Intel(R) SMBus Subsystem Vendor & Device ID for ASF
SMBusAsfId.help_text: This setting configures the Intel(R) SMBus Subsystem Vendor & Device ID for ASF. For details see Skylake H / LP SPI Programming guide.

SMBusTcoSlaveSelect.label: SMBus / SMLink TCO Slave Connection
SMBusTcoSlaveSelect.help_text: This setting configures the TCO Slave connection to ether the Intel(R) SMBus or SMLink0. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SLink0Enable.label: SMLink0 Enabled
SLink0Enable.help_text: This setting enables / disables SMLink0 interface. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS. Note: If using Intel(R) NFC this setting must be set to 'Yes'.

SLink0freq.label: SMLink0 Frequency
SLink0freq.help_text: This setting determines the frequency at which the SMLink0 will operate. Note: The recommended setting is '1 MHz'.

SLink1Enable.label: SMLink1 Enabled
SLink1Enable.help_text: This setting enables / disables SMLink1 interface. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS. Note: This setting must be set to 'Yes' if using PCH / MCP Thermal reporting.

SLink1freq.label: SMLink1 Frequency
SLink1freq.help_text: This setting determines the frequency at which the SMLink1 will operate. Note: The recommended setting is '100KHz'.

SLink1GPTargetAddress.label: SMLink1 GP Target Address
SLink1GPTargetAddress.help_text: This setting configures SMLink1 GP Target Address. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SLink1GPTargetEnable.label: SMLink1 GP Target Address Enabled
SLink1GPTargetEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables SMLink1 GP Target Address interface. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS. Note: This setting must be set to 'Yes' if using PCH / MCP Thermal reporting.

SLink1I2cAddress.label: SMLink1 I2C Target Address
SLink1I2cAddress.help_text: This setting configures SMLink1 I2C Target Address. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SLink1I2cEnable.label: SMLink1 I2C Target Address Enabled
SLink1I2cEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables the SMLink1 I2C Target Address. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

NfcRst.label: NFC Reset GPIO Select
NfcRst.help_text: NFC must be enabled in the Networking & Connectivity section to configure this setting.

NfcIrq.label: NFC IRQ GPIO Select
NfcIrq.help_text: NFC must be enabled in the Networking & Connectivity section to configure this setting.

FwUpdate.label: NFC DFU GPIO Select
FwUpdate.help_text: NFC must be enabled in the Networking & Connectivity section to configure this setting.

SlpAGpd6Config.label: SLP_A# / GPD6 Signal Configuration
SlpAGpd6Config.help_text: This setting allows the user to assign the SLP_A# Power Control signal as SLP_A# or as GPD6. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SlpS3Gpd4Config.label: SLP_S3# / GPD4 Signal Configuration
SlpS3Gpd4Config.help_text: This setting allows the user to assign the SLP_S3# Power Control signal as SLP_S3# or as GPD4. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SlpS4Gpd5Config.label: SLP_S4# / GPD5 Signal Configuration
SlpS4Gpd5Config.help_text: This setting allows the user to assign the SLP_S4# Power Control signal as SLP_S4# or as GPD5. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SlpS5Gpd10Config.label: SLP_S5# / GPD10 Signal Configuration
SlpS5Gpd10Config.help_text: This setting allows the user to assign the SLP_S5# Power Control signal as SLP_S5# or as GPD10. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SlpS0TunnelDis.label: SLP_S0# Tunnel
SlpS0TunnelDis.help_text: This setting Enables / Disables the tunneling of the SLP_S0# pin over ESPI to the EC when in ESPI mode.

DeepSxSupportEnable.label: Deep Sx Enabled
DeepSxSupportEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables support for Deep Sx operation. For further details see Skylake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS. Note: Support for Deep Sx is board design dependent.

IshSupported.label: Integrated Sensor Hub Supported
IshSupported.help_text: This setting allows customers to disable ISH on the platform.

IshPowerUpState.label: Integrated Sensor Hub Initial Power Up State
IshPowerUpState.help_text: This setting allows customers to determine the power up state for ISH.

IshSigningPolicy.label: Integrated Sensor Hub Signing Policy
IshSigningPolicy.help_text: This setting determines ISH signing will be checked against the Intel provisioned hash included in the base image or OEM public key hash provisioned on the platform.

Length.help_text: Total size (in bytes) of the ISH code partition including reserved space. It is recommended to be at least 256kb.

InputFile.help_text: Path to your ISH firmware binary file.

PdtBinary.label: PDT Binary File
PdtBinary.help_text: Path to your PDT binary file

DbgOverridePreProdSi.label: Debug Override Pre-Production Silicon
DbgOverridePreProdSi.help_text: Allows the OEM to control FW features to assist with pre-production platform debugging. This control has no effect if used on production silicon. Note: Certain options will do not work when the descriptor is locked (See FW Bring-up Guide for setting details.

DbgOverrideProdSi.label: Debug Override Production Silicon
DbgOverrideProdSi.help_text: Allows the OEM to control FW features to assist with production platform debugging. Note: Certain options will do not work when the descriptor is locked (See FW Bring-up Guide for setting details.

MERstCapCLRst1Enabled.label: Enable Intel(R) ME Reset Capture on CLR_RST#
MERstCapCLRst1Enabled.help_text: This setting configures Intel(R) ME behavior when it resets during CL_RST#1. Note: The recommended default for this setting is 'No'.

MERomBypassEnable.label: Firmware ROM Bypass
MERomBypassEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables firmware ROM bypass. Note: This setting only has affect when the firmware being used has ROM Bypass code present.

DciEnable.label: Direct Connect Interface (DCI) Enabled
DciEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables the DCI interface used for Intel(R) Trace Hub debugging.

RomTraceEmergencyModeEn.label: Intel(R) Trace Hub Emergency Mode Enabled
RomTraceEmergencyModeEn.help_text: When enabled, Intel(R) ME programs Intel(R) Trace hub to send debug traces without target configuration from the Intel(R) System Studio tool. Note: When Intel(R) Trace Hub is enabled to send messages, it might prevent the system from entering deeper sleep states. This is intended for debug purposes only and should not be used in 'the' shipping configuration.

RomTraceSoftEnable.label: Intel(R) Trace Hub Soft Enable
RomTraceSoftEnable.help_text: When set to Yes, enables Intel(R) ME FW trace messages. Note: DCI needs to be enabled on the platform for Intel(R) Trace Hub messages to be captured.

RomTraceDbgMsgsEnable.label: Intel(R) Trace Hub Debug Messages Enabled
RomTraceDbgMsgsEnable.help_text: Intel(R) Trace Hub Debug Messages Enabled - When set to Yes, enables Intel(R) PCH HW trace messages. Note: DCI needs to be enabled on the platform for Intel(R) Trace Hub messages to be captured.

UnlockToken.label: Unlock Token
UnlockToken.help_text: This allows the OEM to input an Unlock Token binary file for closed chassis debug.

UnlockTokenKeyHash.label: Unlock Token Key Hash
UnlockTokenKeyHash.help_text: This allows the OEM to input the hash of the public key needed to verify an OEM Unlock Token. The hash is SHA256 (32-bytes) but will be truncated to the lower 8-bytes.

IdlmFile.label: IDLM Binary
IdlmFile.help_text: This allows an IDLM binary to be merged into output image built by Intel (R) FIT.

SkycamEnable.label: SkyCam Enabled
SkycamEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables the Skycam feature in Skylake-LP based platforms. Note: This setting is a debug override for the Skycam feature, the recommended method to disable this feature is through BIOS.

HyperThreadingDisable.label: Disable Hyperthreading
HyperThreadingDisable.help_text: This setting controls enabling / disabling of Hyper threading. Note: This strap is intended for debugging purposes only. See BIOS Spec for more details on enabling / disabling Hyper threading.

NumActiveCores.label: Number of Active Cores
NumActiveCores.help_text: This setting controls the number of active processor cores. Note: This strap is intended for debugging purposes only. See BIOS Spec for more details on enabling / disabling processor cores.

BistInit.label: BIST Initialization
BistInit.help_text: This setting determines if BIST will be run at platform reset after BIOS requested actions. Note: This strap is intended for debugging purposes only.

FlexRatio.label: Flex Ratio
FlexRatio.help_text: This setting controls the maximum processor non-turbo ratio. Note: This strap is intended for debugging purposes only. See BIOS Spec for more details on maximum processor non-turbo ratio configuration.

CpuMaxFreqBoot.label: Processor Boot Max Frequency
CpuMaxFreqBoot.help_text: This setting determines if the processor will operate at maximum frequency at power-on and boot. Note: This strap is intended for debugging purposes only.

JtagPwrDisable.value: No - No JTAG Power on C10 and Lower
JtagPwrDisable.value_list: No - No JTAG Power on C10 and Lower,,Yes - JTAG Power on C10 and Lower
JtagPwrDisable.label: JTAG Power Disable
JtagPwrDisable.help_text: This setting determines if JTAG power will be maintained on C10 or lower power states. Note: This strap is intended for debugging purposes only.

SaPowerPlaneTopology.label: SA Power Plane Topology
SaPowerPlaneTopology.help_text: This setting determines the SA power plane topology. See Processor EDS for details. Note: This strap should be left at the recommended default setting.

SaVrType.label: SA VR Type
SaVrType.help_text: This setting determines the SA core domain VR type. See Processor EDS for details.

IaPowerPlaneTopology.label: IA Power Plane Topology
IaPowerPlaneTopology.help_text: This setting determines the IA power plane topology. See Processor EDS for details. Note: This strap should be left at the recommended default setting.

IaVrType.label: IA Power Plane VR
IaVrType.help_text: This setting determines the IA core domain VR type. See Processor EDS for details.

RingPowerPlaneTopology.label: Ring Power Plane Topology
RingPowerPlaneTopology.help_text: This setting determines the Ring power plane topology. See Processor EDS for details. Note: This strap should be left at the recommended default setting.

RingVrType.label: Ring VR Type
RingVrType.help_text: This setting determines the Ring domain VR type. See Processor EDS for details.

GtUsPowerPlaneTopology.label: GT_US Power Plane Topology
GtUsPowerPlaneTopology.help_text: This setting determines the GT Unslice power plane topology. See Processor EDS for details. Note: This strap should be left at the recommended default setting.

GtUsVrType.label: GT_US VR Type
GtUsVrType.help_text: This setting determines the GT Unslice domain VR type. See Processor EDS for details.

GtSPowerPlaneTopology.label: GT_S Power Plane Topology
GtSPowerPlaneTopology.help_text: This setting determines the GT slice power plane topology. See Processor EDS for details. Note: This strap should be left at the recommended default setting.

GtSVrType.label: GT_S VR Type
GtSVrType.help_text: This setting determines the GT slice domain VR type. See Processor EDS for details.

SvidPresence.label: SVID Presence
SvidPresence.help_text: This setting determine if SVID rails are present on the platform. See Processor EDS for details.

PlatformImonDisable.label: Platform IMON Disable
PlatformImonDisable.help_text: This strap should be left at the recommended default setting.

EopioPowerPlaneTopology.label: eOPIO Power Plane Topology
EopioPowerPlaneTopology.help_text: This setting determines the eOPIO power plane topology. See Processor EDS for details. Note: This strap should be left at the recommended default setting.

EopioVrType.label: eOPIO VR Type
EopioVrType.help_text: This setting determines the eOPIO domain VR type. See Processor EDS for details.

EdramPowerPlaneTopology.label: EDRAM Power Plane Topology
EdramPowerPlaneTopology.help_text: This setting determines the EDRAM power plane topology. See Processor EDS for details. Note: This strap should be left at the recommended default setting.

EdramVrType.label: EDRAM VR Type
EdramVrType.help_text: This setting determines the EDRAM domain VR type. See Processor EDS for details.

SeKeyMode.label: SE Key Mode
SeKeyMode.help_text: Note: This strap should be left at the recommended default setting.
